comments: One of the nicest, yet worst teachers I\'ve ever met. Does a horrible job explaining concepts, can\'t stay on topic, and leaves a lot of material for the student to learn on their own. Find another CHM professor unless you are fine with learning all the material on your own. Also, some CHM is a prereq thus no reason to complain about that.
Such a nice lady, but very confused and terrible at teaching. Dyslexia is not meant for the classroom.

I\'m really having a hard time understanding why Dr. Purnell has such a bad rating on here. She really is wonderful, and is very helpful. She does tend to jump around a bit from subject to subject, and moves pretty fast but she really doesn\'t deserve the rating she has. There is very little work outside of class, and labs suck but they always do.

I would not recommend her if you have not taken chemistry recently. She does jump from subject to subject, but honestly she is not a horrible teacher at all. If you pay attention in her class and don\'t confuse YOURSELF, you will be okay. I feel that the only reason people did so horrible in my class is because they asked useless questions.

Nice person, but NOT a good instructor. I am an A/B student with a 4 year degree and had recently taken 131 but I dropped the class because I was frustrated beyond belief. I cannot understand why she is still teaching at WT or anywhere for that matter.
worst teacher I have had @ Wake Tech...teaches way too fast, homework is confusing and never matches tests/classwork,always late to labs, and hard to understand.
Not a good teacher. Returns graded items slow or not at all. At least she is lenient on grading.

If you come into the class not having taken a chem class she expects you to know ALL the basics of chem. Doesn\'t know how to explain concepts well, writes practice problems on the board, SHE quickly does the problem and expects you to know what she did. Doesn\'t spend enough time on topics...She rushes through everything!

She was a very nice person who should not be teaching. I worked way harder than I should have had to to get my grade. She seemed to jump from subject to subject and nothing was explained fully. The tests were much harder than the homework/quizzes, but she graded them pretty easy. Overall, very nice, but definitely find a different teacher.
She has to be the worst teacher I have ever had. Very unorganized and constantly made errors in her teacher and was not able to correct herself. Did not explain anything well.
She has to be the worst teacher I have ever had. Very unorganized and constantly made errors in her teaching and was not able to correct herself. Did not explain anything well.

She is very willing to help any student when they do not understand, the problem is, however, she doesn\'t know how to help. She does not teach clearly, and is very disorganized. She is one of the nicest teachers I have had at Wake Tech, but not one of the best teachers. I would highly suggest finding a new chem teacher.

She goes out of the way a LOT to try and help. The problem she has is staying on task. She goes on random tangents that are neat historically, but are not subject matter related, and often contradict what you are supposed to learn. She also has a hard time communicating the subject matter, in a way which is easy to understand.

Very nice woman. She really wants to help you, however the presentation comes across as very confusing. I found the order that we covered concepts was seemingly backwards... learning bonding before atomic structure etc. You\'ll have to teach yourself from the book... which is dense. Test material doesn\'t match hw.
She is one of the hardest teachers at Wake Tech. She dosent explain things throughly and half my class dropped her. Do not take her.
Very hard to understand, grades tests harshly. She is a nice lady, but she jumps all over the place and is not clear. Take someone else.

I have taken this professor in spring 09. She is indeed not the best professor, and she does make many mistakes, would recommend taking Metzger for 151, also just a side note, if you have not taken a refresher course on chem YOU WILL FAIL.

Probably the worst teacher I have ever had. She makes mistakes regularly in class but then grades her students\' homework/quizzes/tests harshly. She gets frazzled and does not explain things in a clear simple manner. She is completely clueless. Over half of my class has dropped it or is failing but she will not curve.

Dr. Purnell treats college students like high school students. She makes many mistakes when writing out examples to the class (almost on a daily basis), but keep in mind she is dyslexic, so that is not a point to criticize her teaching skills of. Would not recommend her at all...her class averages on tests are pretty low.
